website_summaries.verdict: The best spatula set available. These kitchen tools offer a variety of useful sizes and a sturdy design along with a top-notch guarantee if anything goes wrong.
pros: A 3-piece set that earns our top marks for S-Core internal stainless steel handles capable of standing up to virtually any kitchen chore
Seamless 1-piece design backed by a lifetime guarantee
cons: Some cooks found them a bit rigid when it comes to scraping bowls and jars
Reports of cracks after repeated dishwasher cycles, but the warranty provides peace of mind

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: These (lifetime warranteed) spatulas did crack and pieces broke off. When I tried to redeem my warranty, no response from the company. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: ELAnn

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive advertising
customer_reviews.text: The description says that these are good to 600 deg F. Not true!! I received them today and the box clearly says 450 deg F. I paid more for these because of the higher temperature rating. Pure dishonesty and deception.
customer_reviews.author: WLaurenB

customer_reviews.title: Thick edges, soft material
customer_reviews.text: The silicone on these is significantly softer than on other completely silicone encapsulated spatulas I've used. They compensate for that by making the edges thicker, on the ones with corners, which is a problem for me because I often use these things to scoop under stuff, like scrambling eggs. That's kind of okay since the more spoon like one still has reasonably thin edges. But I still prefer the thicker material and thinner edges of others (which I unfortunately don't know the brand of).
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Barwell

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: We are very satisfied with these spatulas. Being molded into one piece, as these are, is preferable to ones where the handle detaches from the spatula and water and food get into the hole. The shapes are good, and they work well. I thought I was disappointed in the narrow spatula because it has a shorter handle than I am used to. I contacted the company, and they sent me a long-handled narrow spatula. In the meantime, I discovered that I will use the short handled-spatula more than expected. I bought this set based on a review in Cook's Illustrated. When they arrived, my husband spotted them in the drawer immediately. They have become his favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson

customer_reviews.title: These do not feel cheap!
customer_reviews.text: As a semi retired chef, I can honestly say these feel good in my hands. A good weight and they feel like I have a solid tool to work with. I tend to push hard on my utensils and bang them hard on stuff. These seem to hold their own and come back for more. Not overly flexible in the middle (a good thing) and softer toward the edges (a better thing) lets me scrape bowls and pans with confidence and speed. The one piece design makes for ease of cleaning and sanitizing.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Irish

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!! Great designing, quality feel!
customer_reviews.text: These spatulas are so nice! I love that there are no seams or depressions for stains to get caught up in. I love each piece and the color (red) is going with a lot of my kitchen. My other set (photograph/left side) got stained pretty quickly after buying...to my disappointment, but they were my first set of decent spatulas, now retired!
customer_reviews.author: Georgianna

customer_reviews.title: Not rigid enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a few of my wooden handled heat proof spatulas that were at the end of their life. Thinking the all silicone would be easier to clean than wood, and seeing the good reviews, I felt like they were a good choice. After months of use, I find myself going back to the one wood handle spatula I have left, it is MUCH better for scraping bowls of batter and really everything else. The silicone lacks a rigidity or is just harder to control. I'll be replacing these with wood!
customer_reviews.author: R. Voboril

customer_reviews.title: Updated | Not as durable as i was lead to believe
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I contacted Di Oro regarding the problem with the spoonula and I am happy to say that they do indeed stand by their lifetime warranty for their products. They replied to my messages promptly and refunded the cost of the items. ————————— Was using the spoonula for a couple of weeks and it was doing well until today when i was cooking fried rice with eggs and noticed when i was washing the spoonula that the edge was all jagged. I had to trash the food since it had bits of spoonula in it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best spatula's I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many spatula's over the years. I tend to buy them from Williams Sonoma because I have an outlet near me. However, after about a year of use (sometimes sooner), they start to fall apart. I don't even put them in the dishwasher! The worst part is that the rubber starts to chip away and I am afraid of consuming it! To compare them to these, these spatula's are tough, made well, and the rubber feels like it could last forever! They hold up to hand folding of heavy ingredients too. Fantastic product and I will be buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: N. Good

customer_reviews.title: DiOro Stands Behind Their "Forever Warranty"
customer_reviews.text: First off, I really like these kitchen utensils. They get a heck of a workout in our kitchen, especially in the Covid era. Because we rely on these so much I was bummed out when I noticed what looked like bubbling from under the silicone. it appeared to be where the rigid handle inside stopped inside the spoon surface. I dropped DiOro a message and a picture and just like that they sent me a replacement. Great customer service and great products all around. I certainly see additional purchases in my future.
customer_reviews.author: Onefelipe

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of spatulas (and one spoonula)
customer_reviews.text: These are well-made spatulas with high heat tolerance that don't bend much. That it comes in a set at a slight discount is just icing on the cake. The spoonula is quite handy if you are feeling lazy and primarily want a spatula but might need to fish something out. No problems with cleaning, breakage or handling. Having agonized over various single spatulas before settling on this set, I now realize that having 3 different ones covers all the use cases I could imagine. Just get this set and stop trying to do everything with one spatula.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ortega

customer_reviews.title: More useful than expected
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical but purchased 2 sets of the 3 packs. These are working out very well. The size and shape variety helps reach into narrow jars or scoop batter into tins. Black finish should help mask any stains but do end up showing water spots out if dishwasher. Much more useful than I expected. We'll see how long they last. Peace
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Di Oro Seamless Series 3-Piece Silicone Spatula Set
customer_reviews.text: ok so far. but i haven't used them much since buying them. but i did notice that they bulge a little in the middle of the flat spoon end of the spatula when in use. it would seem that the inner metal core at the center of the spatula bulges a bit. it looks it would seem that the silicone is coming away from the metal insert on the flat spoon end of the spatula so the silicone bulges in the middle. i don't know if it will get worse. only perhaps after some more use and time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: alpha

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in these spatulas. Usually I trust the test kitchen that so highly recommends this brand. I find them to be too thick at the edges, way too heavy, like using a garden tool. A bigger handle does not equate ease of use, just too much bulk. Also, these are kept in a utensil crock on my counter and the handle is so big that the silicone actually prevents me from easily removing other items in the crock. Lack of drawers means they must live in one of three crocks I use for cooking utensils. They are not pleasant to use.
customer_reviews.author: LMD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Spatulas
customer_reviews.text: I found these spatulas as America's Test Kitchen had reviewed and recommended them. I was tired of the ones that were in two parts and in time would come apart. I bought these and have been very happy with them. They are both solid and flexible, and easy to clean. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Girl

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed with these spatulas
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally melted my boyfriend's spatula last year (I've never NOT had a silicone spatula!) and bought these to replace it. Best kitchen purchase I have ever made!!! I am obsessed with these spatulas. I realize how weird that sounds, but I'm serious. I use them every day. They're perfect. I'm not afraid of melting them and the one piece construction is everything. The tops don't come off, which means you can get pretty aggressive with them while stirring. And they're easy to clean because residue can't hide out between the top and the handle. They're also super sturdy. I'm contemplating buying another set so I don't get upset when they're all in the dishwasher and the dishwasher is running!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight to these spatulas...Great quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the set of three seamless spatulas in black... they are totally great, one problem I see is now I need to buy a set of the larger spatulas! These have a great weight to them, don’t feel like if you use a little elbow grease they are gonna break... and my most favourite part seamless means no funky gunk getting under the silicone! Price point on Dioro is a little higher than average, but money well spent. I don’t see having to throw Dioro products in the trash and replace em in 4-6 months like I have been... 5 STARS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dink

customer_reviews.title: ... spatulas silicon material is very soft and not of good quality, I used once to mix the dough ...
customer_reviews.text: The spatulas silicon material is very soft and not of good quality, I used once to mix the dough and it is already cracked. The workmanship for the item is inferior in that the edge of the item is not smooth. The handle is also weak and bends easily when force on as it it is going to break. It's a total disappointment for the set and I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Z

customer_reviews.title: Forever Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought my 3-piece set of the Seamless Spatulas in January 2019. I really like how they are flexible, sturdy and very high-heat resistant. I still say they are sturdy even though after 1 1⁄2 years of using the large spatula to mix stiff bread dough, the plastic did crack where the metal core ends as seen in other reviewers’ images. I emailed Di Oro with an image of my spatula and they very quickly responded and sent me a replacement within one week. Few companies have a warranty that covers normal wear and tear. Thank you DiOro for your great customer service and great Forever Warranty!
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and shape of these spatulas, but the stainless steel core is too flexible. Under pressure, the handle bends. I prefer a wooden or steel handle that remains stiff under pressure. After a month, I am coming back to lower from three stars to two. The entire spatula is too flimsy. I can't scrape the sides of bowls, because the edges bend in. I definitely do not recommend this product. The spatulas are fine for very light work, but they aren't useful tools for a serious cook.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harmer-Dionne

customer_reviews.title: Great silicone Spatulas
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after watching the America’s Test Kitchen YouTube video about silicone spatulas. I have used each one now and am very happy with their durability and heat resistance. If you lick them off at the end before wasting, you do get a fairly strong silicone flavor, but maybe that will fade over time. I have not noticed a transfer of that flavor to my food at all. I will just have to use a spoon to taste what I am making. I don’t want to think about the estrogenic activity in my food, since I have not found a material that is as easy to use in all kinds of cooking/baking.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Shively

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on the review of a blogger. I was looking forward to using them. But sadly they are really flimsy I would not recommend them. Go to Kohl’s and buy the food network ones.
customer_reviews.author: McLain Fam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect -love these
customer_reviews.text: I treated myself to the three piece set. It's more expensive than similar sets made by other companies but these are exactly what I wanted and needed. The edges have the right stiffness to easily and cleanly scrape out jars, bowls, pans, pots, etc. I use the bigger spatula to scrape stuck on food from pans while cooking and to make scrambled eggs. It's much easier to use this one than my big flipper spatula. They all clean up in a snap and look --and smell --brand new (never absorb or hold odors ever-- plus no grooves or cracks for stuff to hide in).
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Essential in Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Every kitchen needs this. I used to make silicone spatulas where the handles where wooden but They don’t seem to last long. I hate it when the wooden handles stay in water too long because I feel like mold can grow and the wood can start splitting. However these silicone spatulas do not have that problem. They are easy to clean from the base to the handle.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Better Versatility
customer_reviews.text: I normally use softer silicon spatulas for mixing but found they will break at the tip if the batter is too stiff. After watching an episode of America's Test Kitchen where they tested many different spatulas, we decided to try out their winner which is the Di ORO. I like that they are stiff at the bottom half but still retain some flexibility which provides more versatility for the most part. But it does hinder the ability to sufficiently scrap the entire side of a bowl or dish. Regardless, these spatulas work exactly as I need them to.
customer_reviews.author: freesia3

customer_reviews.title: I don't think spatulas are supposed to age like wine, but.
customer_reviews.text: Almost three years ago, I bought these spatulas. Unfortunately, at the time, I found them to be*way* too soft, and as such, useless. They wound up at the back of my kitchen utensils drawer as a result. But this past weekend, I needed a spatula, needed one quickly, and all of my "good" ones were in the sink and I didn't have time to wash one up. Then I grabbed one of these, started wondering why I didn't use them more often, and then remembered why. It took two years and some change, but eventually, they have stiffened up into something actually usable.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled

customer_reviews.title: The Best Set
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking/baking with these tools - the spoon shaped one is great for making caramels and other treats and scrambled eggs. With other tools, food would get stuck in the crevices and with these you just rinse them clean - no more stuck egg gunk on your utensil. The flat bottom also makes it easy to ensure you are completely stirring all ingredients in the pan - less risk of burnt on food. They are sturdy, yet flexible. Would definitely buy again and would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: GWGirl

customer_reviews.title: No ingredients left behind
customer_reviews.text: I have used wooden spoons my entire life. I used one of these Silicone spatulas at someone's house and I bought a set the next day. They scrape ingredients out of the bowl and into the pot better than wood could ever hope to do. Clean up is very easy. I still give wood a slight edge on mixing and the difference is not enough to make me turn to wood again.
customer_reviews.author: Tdog137

customer_reviews.title: The best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I am slowly replacing my spatulas with this brand. I like to cook and bake a lot and have used several different brands of spatulas over the years. On a whim and recommendation I ordered a set a few years ago. They are strong, hold up well don't get sticky. I find myself digging through my collection for these everytime. I highly recommend them. Purchase them...you won't regret it. I have both the black and red.
customer_reviews.author: K. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Search Bias
customer_reviews.text: I like the spatula set. The quality is good but I would not have made the purchase had I realized they were from China. This detail is well hidden on the Amazon site. Surprizingly. a Amazon search for “spatula and made-in-usa” shows this spatula set as the first listed. So Amazon’s search engine is either not accurate or perhaps dishonest. I have since found a made in USA spatula set of better quality (not available from Amazon), so perhaps Amazon will add this to their site.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Basic Functionality
customer_reviews.text: My wife just broke the 3rd of her old silicone spatulas. These appear to be of much better construction. If I had any critical comments it would be than the silicone is a bit more rigid. But, even at that, they are usable and actually a bit better at blending with the increased rigidity...just a tad harder to get into those tiny crevasses that you'll find in some pans.
customer_reviews.author: B Gates

customer_reviews.title: America's Test Kitchen recommended this spatula so I went for the 3 pack
customer_reviews.text: America's Test Kitchen recommended this spatula so I went for the 3 pack. They have never steered me wrong before and they certainly didn't this time either. The spatulas are heavy and durable against heat, cold, liquid, and solids such as icing and dough. They don't bend or flex under hand and the material is pleasant to the touch. The red color is vibrant and I can easily find it in my utensil drawer. I will purchase this set as gifts for fellow cooks!
customer_reviews.author: Wine MamaTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Search for best kitchen spatulas... This brand was a top winner! Sturdy easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I can say nothing negative about this brand of kitchen Tools! I also purchased the fish turner and another spatula. All are so sturdy thick and at first glance extremely well-made. I have not use them a lot yet, but from everything I have read I am certainly looking forward to it! They were easy to clean by hand, although it says they are safe for the dishwasher. I love that it takes the high heat!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and comfortable spatula
customer_reviews.text: I like these spatula very much. They are very comfortable to hold and durable. I do not eat much outside, so I cook all my meals at home. I use typical electric stove and these spatulas are workin very well. They are very durable against the high heat. I am very pleased to have these in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad A Islam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect spatulas!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, something as simple as a spatula can go very, very wrong. I have used a lot of different types and these di Oro spatulas are, hands down, the best spatulas. They are firm, making it easy to lift ingredients for serving, and to chop ingredients in the pan. I can rest them on the edge of the pan without melting or burning them, and they stay cool to the touch. Plus, they clean easily and aren’t porous so I don’t have to worry about them picking up any smells. I can not recommend them enough.
customer_reviews.author: Abcxyz

customer_reviews.title: Best Spatulas Ever
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased others that had metal in the handle... and ended up nicking the edges of my All Clad non stick pans. These - recommended on America's Test Kitchen - are simply... perfect. Comfortable, easy to clean (oh so easy) and work perfectly. I bought an extra spatula, and they're among the most used gadgets in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Pat In NYC

customer_reviews.title: Good for mixing/scraping, not so much for breaking up meats while browning.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously ordered a four piece set and liked it enough to order this set, making it possible to cook dinner two nights in a row (using part of one set for the first night and putting it in the dishwasher, and then using the second set for the second night and placing it in the dishwasher--we run the dishwasher about every other night). They work well for mixing, bowl/pan scraping; they aren't as good for breaking up ground meats while browning (I use a wooden spoon). I like the stiff handles paired with heads that are just flexible enough to be used for stirring, deglazing, and scraping food out of the pan and into another container.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set after I snapped a spatula in half trying to get a batch of homemade ice cream out of the work bowl & into a storage container. I really wanted something with a reinforced handle that would stand up to heavy use and these fit that bill perfectly. Plus, as an added bonus, the blade potion of these are flexible enough to conform to the surface that you are scraping without being flimsy -- one of the most significant complaints I've had about silicon kitchen utensils. Couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rae Koziczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Spatula shape could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: I like these but the middle of the spatula head bulges a too much. This means that the spatula is good for stirring but not for picking something up or trying to flip things like a pancake or even eggs. A slightly flatter spatula head would be more all-around useful.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sung

customer_reviews.title: If they last, you won't need to buy spatulas for years!
customer_reviews.text: Love these spatulas. I use the spoontula and mini spatula the most. At first, I thought the material would be too thick (stirring/scrapping edge) but I was quickly proven wrong. If I was to "wish" for the best of the best, I wish the mini was a bit more flexible on the edge for scraping out goodies from the inside of small containers. The material is very "slickery" and cleanup is a breeze. I'm very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AlinOR

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic. After six months of use they are still ...
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. After six months of use they are still undamaged, clean, and free of any marks. I think the three different sizes that are included are very good, although a smaller one might be even more useful. The spoon shaped one is firm enough to use as a mixing spoon on heavy ingredients. I normally hand wash these, however, when I do use a dish washer they usually get small white water marks all over them. It is easily wiped away with a damp cloth though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Palecek

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for a Great Product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this brand of Silicone Spatulas on American Test Kitchen TV show where it was chosen as best spatula. So I ordered the set and am quite happy with it. The spoon is my favorite so far. It is substantial enough to stir hot polenta and not bend and become a noodle. The handles are very comfortable on all three items in the set. Also the design is very smooth so that there are no seams or crannies for food to get stuck in and make washing a pain. Am delighted. Thanks for a great Product.
customer_reviews.author: AGumb

customer_reviews.title: Primo quality
customer_reviews.text: From the way the spatulas were packaged to the wonderful heft they have, everything about these oozes quality. I especially appreciate the handles, since they have a little bit of padding and a useful, comfortable shape. This helps me since I have nerve and bone problems in my hands. I'm a DI ORO fan now and already ordered another product set of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike The D.

customer_reviews.title: Bought four sets and I will probably get more.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a set of these for myself and one for each of my three daughters. I am so impressed with the quality of these! There is no handle to separate while scraping out a bowl. They wash up easily. They are solid but not overly heavy. The lifetime warranty is just the bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to clean, shape & size good
customer_reviews.text: I have had these until 2005. They are still like new. I use each of them especially the small one for jars and getting around Vitamix blades. The scoop shaped one is great for cooking and serving. No melting or anything so far. Def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Lefties??
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to figure out if spatulas are made for righthanders only. There are just a few I've found over the years that work for me as a lefty and these aren't it. They may be Test Kitchen's top pick but they just don't fit my hand well or work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lady DIY

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These were the best-reviewed silicone set on America's Test Kitchen. I love the "spoonula" the most, but all 3 are very handy. They clean super easily, and I don't have to worry about melting the edges of them when resting on a pot. They don't do as well with very thick recipes when comparing to wooden spoons, etc, but I expected that.
customer_reviews.author: P. McGurn

customer_reviews.title: Voted #1 Spatula on Cook’s Illustrated and in Julie’s Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I saw these reviewed on PBS’s Cook’s Illustrated and since I was in the market for new spatulas for all the cooking and baking - I bought immediately! They are wonderful - I can see why they were top pick on Cook’s Illustrated. ! I highly recommend for all your cooking and baking needs!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.text: I did not know that the ends would be very flexible. I thought they would be stiff. Still, they do the job. I've since purchased other spatulas and use these as backup.
customer_reviews.author: RBC

customer_reviews.title: Get it now. So worth the $20
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. I should have bought them before. They work for all my cooking needs. They are sturdy to scrape the bottom and bendy enough to scrape sides. Just perfect. Also I bought them after I saw America’s test kitchen review. It’s my go to for allkitchen needs
customer_reviews.author: M.N

customer_reviews.title: These are extremely nice high quality Spatulas
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely nice high quality Spatulas. I have been searching for some time for a set of silicon covered spatulas but only found floppy useless ones. So it was with some reservation that I ordered these online without having the benefit of seeing them first. I was not disappointed. They are great and hold up to the job of scrapping down the sides of my mixer bowl while kneading bread dough, but still flexible enough to handle the same task while beating egg whites. It's the Stainless Steel that goes the full length of the tools. It is useful having the 3 quite different blade shapes as well. Will be buying a second set. Very, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: PRC

customer_reviews.title: Good product & the BEST Customer Service!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good assortment of sizes. They appear to be well made. I just got them so I've only used them once but I was very pleased! 2020 UPDATE: I had a small issue with one of my spatulas, so I emailed customer service (late in the evening). To my surprise, I had a return email within the hour! These products have a LIFETIME GUARANTEE! They requested my order number and a pic of the issue and my replacement is already on the way!
customer_reviews.author: Irish Eyes 430

customer_reviews.title: Forever Warranty Honored
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in May 2018 and it replaced all of my other spatulas. I liked these so much I ordered 2 sets for my daughters. This month, February 2018, I noticed a tear in the side of the Spoonula spatula and notified DI ORO and they honored their Forever Warranty without hesitation and are sending me a replacement! They did require a photo but that's understandable. I would highly recommend this product and would purchase again. Their customer service is outstanding. Thank you, DI ORO
customer_reviews.author: Odie

customer_reviews.title: Durable and better than the rest
customer_reviews.text: Great, been using it a ton from tuna to tea. They resist smell great and cleans up fast with nothing hanging in the corners of the handles . They’ve held up great even when kids whack them against counter corners .
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Miller

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, solid warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 5 years ago and they’ve held up great! I’ve left them in plenty of hot pans and never seen any indication they might melt or be damaged. Recently one of them started to crack at the edge, after sending in some pictures and my order number I got a replacement in a few days! The new one seems improved, the edge is a bit thicker so hopefully that makes it last even longer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great one-piece design, high quality
customer_reviews.text: These are super nice spatulas! I use the thin one to scramble eggs with and it reaches all the tight spots in the skillet and is easy to clean afterward. The one-piece design is perfect for keeping clean. There is a steel rod of some sort inside to give the spatulas form. This ends partially through the spatula part, which means that there's just enough flex while still remaining somewhat rigid. The price isn't super great, but it's worth it to me to have a set of nice spatulas that will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Robben

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: This spatula set is everything it's touted to be. The quality and solidity of the set is excellent, and I'm using the heck out of each piece. I especially appreciate the personalized customer service, inquiring if I'm happy with the product. I really like that. I know they'd make it right if I had any issues. As it turns out, I don't. And I'll be recommending this set to others.
customer_reviews.author: TurtleGirl

customer_reviews.title: Pass!
customer_reviews.text: Rubber material instantly flaked off after first use. Lifetime warranty is great but for a faulty product, I 'll pass.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Needed some new spatulas and liked the idea of no separate handle with crevices. The reviews were good so decided to try these. I'm so glad I ordered them. They feel very good in your hands. There is some 'give' at the tips to help get everything out of the bowl or pan but the handles are very sturdy. The one piece design is everything I hoped it would be...no handle to come loose or crevices to hide germs. All in all, a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Connie of GATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: These are FANTASTIC spatulas. I’ve always struggled with finding ones that are perfect; they’re either too stiff, or too flimsy. These seriously strike the perfect balance. Slight flex at the tip, that moves into a nice sturdy handle. Another plus? They’re one solid piece, so there’s no chance these will snap in half, and no chance for food to get stuck anywhere. If you’re a home chef and/or baker, then these are a MUST in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These spatulas are a game changer. I had a cheap $1.99 spatula for two years and was looking for a replacement for a while. I reviewed the America's Test Kitchen video on the best spatula and came across this company. I was a little hesitant about the price but let me tell you they are worth every cent. They are sturdy, durable and very easy to clean. We are very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Strong AND Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Best silicone cooking products I've ever used. Because they are all one piece, there are no cracks or crevices for food to get stuck in. And they're perfect for all applications: scrambling eggs, sautéing onions or other veggies, stirring soups and stews, folding and mixing ingredients, etc.
customer_reviews.author: nan k

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very well made!
customer_reviews.text: What I like best about this product is that it is all one piece, very well made! Other rubber spatulas may be two part, the head comes off the handle. Not good if you are stirring some thick, heavy mixes.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Spatulas do take food smell
customer_reviews.text: My spatulas do take the smell of the food. Would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: LB, W Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Great spatulas
customer_reviews.text: We love these one piece spatulas. We've been cooking more at home and they're great for eggs, blending and folding. We used to have a 2 piece spatula that water would get into where it came together. Don't have to worry about that anymore. Thanks Di Oro!
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Verry functional and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: Older spatulas with wooden handles don't do well long term in the dishwasher. Some flexible spatulas loose their flexibility, and toe older silicone ones that have separate handles, are not as sanitary as these. Mostly I like the spoon type as it does everything. These have a good solid handle that's comfortable and the straight bottom is excellent for stirring up bits from the bottom of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Joan from Elma

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This set of three spatulas are excellent quality. They are strong and sturdy, easy to clean and dry. I purchased because they are 600F Heat Resistant. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cold Coffee (Reviews by Theodocia McLean)

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set to replace my 15 year old Pampered Chef Mix 'N Scraper. Overall, this product is worth the price. The spatulas are durable and easy to use. I like the small one for getting inside peanut butter and jelly jars and the scooped spatula for cooking everything. I still prefer the Pampered Chef spatula overall due to the fact it literally doesn't leave a drop in the bowl. When using any of these spatulas, there is still something left around the edges and I have to make several attempts to completely empty the bowl/jar. I am satisfied with my purchase but will go back to the Pampered Chef spatula when these are worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Lori J McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Most versatile, user-friendly, comfortable, and sturdy utensils I've ever used, and I've used a lot! Their design excells where others cannot perform. A simple task like scraping becomes so easy you didn't know you had a tough time before,haha. I'm going to buy at least two more sets for myself and a couple more to give as gifts during the holiday baking season.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lippincott

customer_reviews.title: One of the best silicone spatula sets
customer_reviews.text: After several months of use, I have to share how much I love these spatulas! These are great on my non-stick cookware. I agree with some of the other reviews about a white film forming after putting them through a cycle in the dishwasher. The stains went away after hand washing them in warm water and Dawn dishwashing liquid. Bottom line - I would spend the money on this set of silicone spatulas again compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: As a person who loves to cook, this by far is the very best and the last Spatula's you will ever have to buy. Stirring a heavy cookie dough is a tough challenge for a regular spatula, not these. I use them to stir scrambled eggs. Heat is no problem, they do not melt. I love the heavy duty feel to them. My only complaint is the smallest one. I wish it had a longer handle, but this is not enough to downgrade my 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. F.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yet bendable!
customer_reviews.text: I searched reviews on spatulas and decided to purchase these. I am super happy with how they work. They are sturdy, yet pliable and have give to scrape the last bit of batter or sauce from the bowl or jar. I recommend washing them by hand if you have hard water so they don't spot.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Borup

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Set
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy unlike another silicon spatula that I have so you can really use them to break stuff apart and stir without splashing in the pan. For the price these are a great find. I got them because they were America's Test Kitchen's "Best Buy."
customer_reviews.author: G. Palaia

customer_reviews.title: All the right shapes and sizes I needed
customer_reviews.text: These are just great. Very easy to clean, and you're not wasting any food left in your pan, pot, container, or bowl. My last wasn't heat resistant, so I'm relearning that it's okay to use these in my hot pans.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey C.

customer_reviews.title: Red Spatulas
customer_reviews.text: I am giving these a three. I really do love them BUT my large one has a split and I have to purchase a new one which I did. I only used the set four times. The other two spatulas are holding up as expected. I am hoping the large one with the split is a defective one. I will updat as soon as I get my new one and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A.

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Sturdiness in All it’s Helpful Glory!
customer_reviews.text: The second I took these out of their packaging I knew these were just as advertised. Tremendous quality with any & all aspects! So glad I purchased these, I threw out all the other spatulas I owned & now swear by these! Great buy, Add to your Cart & be pleased!
customer_reviews.author: DadBodOnFleek

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like the color. I like how it is all one piece. I like it is firm. However, I was really hoping to find a spatula that had fairly sharp edges for scraping bowls, etc. These are good and I use them but I am still trying to find something like this with a sharper edge.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carfagno

customer_reviews.title: Just what i wanted and needed, Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: Ends flex but are a smidge stiffer than I would like. The went through the dishwasher on high temp with heated dry just fine. I have yet to use on a hot pan. They are built well. The silicone is molded around the stainless rod but the texture of the silicone on the outside is kinda rough. Its not perfectly smooth and batter/frosting and such sticks to them more than the real smooth silicone ends on some other products. I like them regardless and would recommend them to anyone. It beats the wooden handle ones that keep soaking up nasty water from the sink.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sieler

customer_reviews.title: I bought these based on the good reviews and awards for the large spatula
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the good reviews and awards for the large spatula. They are very nice. They have a good weight to them and are well-balanced, which makes them very pleasant to use. I particularly like the spoon. I found the edge of the large spatula disappointingly blunt, however, and for that I am subtracting a star. Both the spoon and the small spatula have much more tapered edges in comparison and I'm confused about why the large spatula isn't the same.
customer_reviews.author: Marijane White

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tools, very useful
customer_reviews.text: I previously ordered the single large spatula and because of how good that one was I ordered this set. These are good, solid spatulas, a fantastic upgrade from my old wooden handle ones. Comfortable to hold and use.
customer_reviews.author: David Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: So when one of them got severely burned on a camping trip (I'm pretty sure alcohol was involved)
customer_reviews.text: We had owned the two-piece silicone spatulas previously, but I was always sort of grossed out by the fact that I couldn't get every little speck of food out of the insides of the spatula piece, even when I separated it and stuck it in the dishwasher. So when one of them got severely burned on a camping trip (I'm pretty sure alcohol was involved), I took the opportunity to upgrade to the one-piece variety. These fit the bill perfectly! One piece, easily cleaned, and well made. No gross-out factor any more!
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my husband the home chef, and he really loves them. We've gone through several spatulas in the past couple of years, they always wind up getting small cuts in them where I worry food will be trapped or whatever - these are holding up excellently, however, and we love that they are black. Not grey-ish black, but actually black. They match well in our kitchen and get plenty of use. Will update if we ever have to toss them due to product issues beyond regular wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: zinseng

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but a bit too stiff
customer_reviews.text: The Di Oro Seamless Series 3-Piece Silicone Spatula Set is very well designed. I love the one-piece design to prevent the handle sliding off as it gets older. The set as a whole is very functional, however, I find it a bit too stiff to actually scrape things very smoothly, which what spatulas are really made for. So, I wish the rubber was a bit softer to allow for smooth scraping.
customer_reviews.author: Foxy

customer_reviews.title: Ugly white film after first run through dishwasher, no response from Di Oro
customer_reviews.text: I received my red Di Oro Seamless Series 3-Piece Silicone Spatula Set from Amazon yesterday and put it in the dishwasher before use. When the dishwasher finished, these spatulas all have a white hazy film on them! I am SO disappointed, particularly since these were highly recommended recently by America's Test Kitchen. Also, the contact URL for dissatisfied customers, provided on the product insert - dioro.com/support - gives an Error 404 Page Not Found message. I sent a message through their customer service function but one week later have had no reply. Returning these to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: KSkim

customer_reviews.title: Great utensils for kitchen attire!
customer_reviews.text: These are just what you need in whatever your ideal kitchen might consist of. I cook for myself and I'm on a schedule. These utensils help me efficiently get the job done every day. I will order other products by this company again soon!
customer_reviews.author: Hariel

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous spatulas.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the long handles the spatulas have & that they withstand high heat if needed. I also ordered another spatula that was from the same company after the first set. That to had a long handle which was for getting into jars. It helps that the American Test Kitchen recommened them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Callihan

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Solid Build
customer_reviews.text: America's Test Kitchen did a review of the large spatula and they raved about the design and how substantial it is. After using it for the first time, I agree completely. It has a nice heft and firmness you don't usually find in other spatulas. Once we looked at the prices, it made economical sense to buy the 3 piece set. I'm sure we'll get years of use from them.
customer_reviews.author: marquis

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: These are the very best spatulas ever. They are one piece, that means there is no mold growing inside the top part of the product. They take stirring in hot foods very well. No melting signs or anything. wash beautifully, and they are quite durable. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Pollyanna

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I do love this product but haven’t had the chance too really test it yet. So review update. This product works fairly well especially after it got more flexible when I ran it through the dishwasher in the top rack but I still think you need the older spatula designs for some things. Still overall a fairly well designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Shankman

customer_reviews.title: simply the best + most versatile spatulas
customer_reviews.text: these spatulas do a wonderful job for most things a home cook will do. the one exception is big volume / thick cake or cookie batters ... the only thing that works well for that is the big rubbermaid spatula, which is too big for most things. these are now my go-to workhorses in the kitchen. the flat spatula works great for making a roux or stirring a custard or making a cream sauce.
customer_reviews.author: r s perkins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing spatula, must have!
customer_reviews.text: This spatula are amazing, I bought them after saw the review on America's Test kitchen I really wish I bought also the black set, and I can't wait to buy their new tongs Don't hesitate - oh and this can work as a great gift for someone that likes to cook
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this set
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got the set instead of just one because these are so helpful to have. I use my blender a lot when preparing meals and these are great for scraping out every last bit. Love them for smoothing out icing, ice cream, etc. The small one is great for getting the last bit out of a jar. They have a substantial feel in your hand which sets them apart from others.
customer_reviews.author: DAWN REDMOND

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm liking these. I wanted spatulas that were thin but somewhat stiff and wouldn't melt in pans and I wanted flat handles. You can't find those anymore. But these are pretty nice. They don't melt, they're stiff enough to dig shortening out of the can, yet flexible enough to mold to the shape of whatever I'm trying to scrape something out of. The handles aren't flat but they're not too big around. I've been using them almost daily for a couple of months now and they feel like they're going to last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great set of spatulas!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, ergonomic, with the right amount of give in the spatula area. Be careful if cleaning in dishwasher - the red color can transfer to other items it touches, and detergents leave a white residue that has to be hand washed off..
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best spatulas I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the best spatulas I have ever owned! Some spatulas you buy in department stores will have a silicone end and usually a wooden or plastic handle. They always break at the connection point. The spatulas are covered entirely with silicone. Unless you leave them in your oven while it is self cleaning, they will not melt and will last a very long time. The handles are very ergonomic and the silicone handle prevents them from slipping out of your hand. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Spatula Set
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set when I had to purchase a new non stick pan. I really like the look and feel of these utensils and the fact that they will stand up well to being used regularly. They wash well which is important to me since I am a picky cleaner. I also do not have to worry about the issue of heat these have the capability to deal with high heat. I have used these spoons quite frequently since I receiving them. I love this set and am looking at other pieces, thus I highly recommend this set if you are in the kitchen frequently.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hillerman

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid stuff...
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff to work with. Smooth, durable, good to hold. These spatulas are stiff enough so you can really scrape the bottom if you are blending a dish. They are extremely comfortable to hold. Far and away my favorites for this type of a task.
customer_reviews.author: Rogier F. van Vlissingen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these spatulas in April 2017, so I've had them for over 3 years. The biggest spatula split at the top. I got in touch with Di Oro warranty department. Jessica from warranty got right back to me and replaced my spatula. This company stands by its "Forever Warranty" and I highly recommend these spatulas. I love them and use them all the time. I've definitely gotten my moneys worth and then some. Thanks Jessica!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lorri Freedman

customer_reviews.title: America's Test Kitchen was right!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent spatulas; solid silicone over metal, your arm will tire before these give out. Very sanitary. Gave a few as gifts to my friends who are bakers.
customer_reviews.author: Linzleh

customer_reviews.title: They are what they say they are
customer_reviews.text: Everything I thought they would be, saw them on test kitchen, found them on amazon and have used all of them everyday since they arrived. Allowed me to throw every other spatula I had. No more removable heads for ease of cleaning (which never worked or were even cleanable). These are strong but flexible and because of the steel rod in them they have a substantial feel to them. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: DI ORO Seamless Series 3-Piece Silicone Spatula Set - 600°F Heat Resistant Non Stick Rubber Kitchen Scraper Spatulas for Cooking, Baking, and Mixing – BPA Free and LFGB Certified Silicone (Black)
feature_bullets: ONLY THE BEST – Each piece in the DI ORO 3-Piece Seamless Silicone Spatula Set is made with BPA Free and LFGB Certified Silicone. Built to withstand the heat, each spatula is heat-resistant up to 600°F, which means you will never melt your favorite spatula.

CLEANS EASY, SANITARY DESIGN – You will be happy to know that your Award-Winning DI ORO Seamless Series Spatulas are dishwasher safe or can be quickly and effortlessly cleaned by hand. The one-piece seamless silicone design prevents buildup of food and bacteria, which allows for safe and healthy cooking.

VARIETY IS THE SPICE OF LIFE – Each spatula is designed with enough flexibility to conform to bowls if scraping, strong enough to handle the toughest batters if mixing, and creatively shaped to easily handle a multitude of tasks in your kitchen. The ergonomically designed and velvety smooth handle will fit like a glove in the palm of your hand.

THE PERFECT COMPLEMENT TO NON-STICK COOKWARE - Whether cooking the perfect scrambled eggs or sautéing a medley of summer vegetables, you can rest assured that our non-stick pro-grade silicone will not scratch your expensive cookware.

OUR PROMISE, OUR FOREVER WARRANTY – Our customers mean everything to us, so at DI ORO we have set the bar with our Forever Warranty and second to none customer service. We will replace any damaged or defective product for free or provide a full refund if you are not satisfied with your purchase.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,572 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
